summary: I OWN A 2002 CHEVROLET TRAILBLAZER LTZ.  WHEN DRIVING AT AROUND 54 MPH AND 1600 RPM'S THE SUV PRODUCES A VIBRATION THAT CAN BE HEARD AND FELT THROUGHT OUT THE VECHICLE.  TO THE BEST OF MY KNOWLEDGE NEITHER GM OR THE DEALERSHIPS KNOWS WHAT IS CAUSING THE VIBRATION.  IT IS WITH OUT A DOUBT SOMETHING THAT SHOULD NOT BE HAPPENING.  I ALSO KNOW OTHER PEOPLE WITH THE SAME SUV HAVING THE SAME PROBLEM.  DOES IT DO DAMAGE TO MY SUV EVERY TIME IT HAPPENS?  MOST IMPORTANTLY IT HAPPENS AT HIGHWAY SPEED.  I DON'T WANT SOMETHING TO GO WRONG AT 54 MPH.  THANK YOU.  ANY QUESTIONS PLEASE FEEL FREE TO CONTACT ME.   *PLEASE NOTE I ENTERED TODAYS DATE BELOW BUT IT HAPPENS ALL THE TIME AND HAS BEEN SINCE I BOUGHT THE SUV BRAND NEW.
